title: This is absolutely uncalled for, and a huge mess for high elo players...
body:
http://imgur.com/RLRJXC5

As you can see, I am currently as "FILL" WTF?

Hello, I am currently at challenger 141 lp, and I am here, extremely annoyed by this new champ select. With the old one, I would get 5 minute queues and get my role 90% of the time, because people in this elo know each other and what they can do.  Now, I'm getting my role maybe 65% of the time and these obnoxious queue times like this link up here along with 10% of the time against a full LCS team. I literally can't play a game due to the queue times. 

Solution? PLEASE make it where if you are ranked master or higher you get the old champion select. The new one is only being used because of lower elo players and their problems, but completely screws over high elo players since there is a lack of players. 

Again, the roles being selected before each match is completely useless in this elo, because people know each other anyways and give their role up.

I've also never heard a streamer like Meteos say one positive thing about these new champion select, mainly because of these queue times that are easily avoidable for high elo....please riot

replies.body: Ouch. And I though 5 minutes was obnoxious.
I knew i would start getting long queue times, but this is a little too long

And to think Rito said this would "hopefully decrease queuing time for higher elo players" xD

Poor diamond 2s and above. That shit would infuriate me.
They can help it, but it will always be way higher than it was before due to the fact that we can choose roles, its like shoving a bowling ball into a water hose...

I'm still not sure I understand what about the new system causes waits like this at high elo. I get that there's an uneven distribution of role preferences. What happened before? People sometimes got stuck with a role that wasn't their best, right? If one manages to climb to such a high tier even while sometimes being forced to fill, presumably that means that everybody is capable of playing every role to some degree. My question, then, is why aren't more people volunteering to fill? Not *everybody* because, as you've said there are one-trick ponies. But more people than currently are. Surely wait times of an hour or more justify some flexibility, no?

No, with the old champion select you get paired up with people that have close to your mmr, now you need to find the players with chosen roles that doesn't go against yours + mmr. Due to the lack of players in this elo, it is harder to find the right player with the mmr and the certain roles chosen to get into a game

Try making fill your primary
:^)

Well, the thing is, if you play a role you don't feel too comfortable in your disadvantage is huge compared to lower Elo players. If you're a mid/support main and you've suddenly gotta jungle against a jungle main with his main champ you'll most likely not have a chance. Of course any player in this Elo would be able to play most champs in different positions, but they'll often have their main roles in which they're a huge lot more efficient.
I agree with him keep it the way it was for High elo, but for lower Elo i kind of like the new rank games.

The system is also matching a group of solo players vs teams still. In the past 8 games I've played trying to get back to silver, I've been against teams consisting of 2-4 people and no one on my team were in groups based on the questions I've asked them.
Yep, Here is my op.gg http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Serious+ADC+LFT , and you can see that I had to go up against a full C9 team with a non-voice chatted solo team.
But dang, you guys still won, that's pretty cool
so it was the real sneaky and meteos ?

Yeah, look at his match history

C9 Jensen	   
C9 Rush	     
Mayer Adlet	      	
C9 Hai	      
C9 Sneaky

were all on the same team, and since he's in Challenger that makes sense. (Meteos isn't really C9 anymore)

I mean you guys had 3 challanger players, 1 master player and a diamond one player...
while they had a bunch of diamond 5's and a plat 1.
However, the communication is stronger on the other side.

> [{quoted}](name=Unknown JungIer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3K2ALGzp,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-01-27T02:09:24.179+0000)
>
> Yep, Here is my op.gg http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Unknown+JungIer , and you can see that I had to go up against a full C9 team with a non-voice chatted solo team.

atleast u get your role dude..for those not so high (p2 currently-)i get my role in almost 50% of my games, and this is, if they give me jungle:))..or else i would probably have a 20-30% jungle games
My op.gg there are mostly filled up with the games that I was playing with the old champion select (Because i can't fking play a game LOL), also whenever I get mid lane, I go corki or ezreal.
low key your pretty good lol

http://puu.sh/mKXfe/b743102b43.jpg

Well that was normal draft. Guess I'll just play blind pick before going back to ranked.

Seriously tho this is not ok
Sorry bro the majority of league players suck at this game. Get bad son.
Nightblue is getting ~3 minute queue times. Don't know what's up with you.
There is a 3x more player base in EUW, that is where he plays right?
Yup. Also I saw you in the challenger thing, and I was really confused when I saw you here hehe.
Haha, just frustrated cause I'm not able to play many games >:O
So in theory eventually all high elo players with use fill to circumvent the retarded queue times?
I don't think everybody will go "fill" since there are 1 trick ponies, but if we just let master/challenger tier players get old champ select, everybody is happy!

by everyone taking fill it essentially makes it like the old queue and one trick ponies can still play who they want. You aren't forced to go mid if the game tells you you are mid, if the one trick pony guy is really a top main he can go top just like he used to. (this would only work in high elo though since everyone knows eachother or something like that)

Why hasn't this been answered yet?
The answer may be:

"Hey there Unknown Jungler!

We're sorry that you've been experiencing this problem, & understand that this can really stop you from doing something you enjoy. We've taken notice of this as well, & have been trying to find a better way of going about it. I know I'd hate to wait 90 minutes to find a match, but what you could try is restarting the search, & it may just get you into a match sooner. With our numbers, & coding that we can't exactly explain at this moment, & the problems that have risen up from the new champion selection, we are working on this problem, along with anything else that manages to pop up.

So far we've been able to make the new champion select live once again, but feel there could still potentially be issues that we are looking into such as the constant dodges, & players not locking in. I do apologize for the trouble you've encountered. It should never take this long to find a match, & I'll bring this up with the other rioters, & we will get back to you.


-A Rioter"
Your actually an undercover rioter, nice try guy
I like the rank shaming mid way through the post. As if the lower ranks are the root cause for all your problems lol.

He's saying low-elo players had seperate issues with their QUEUEs which the Dynamic System attempts to alleviate, but doesn't help the high-elo queues.

Not that it really helped us, either. People still just queue up and ignore their assigned role, trying to claim "pick order"
wow... I havent encountered that yet... :(

Yeah, I tried it out the other day and the supp picked an adc champ anyway. It's a good idea in theory but unless it actually limits the champ pool available when you select there will always be that possibility.

Actually you can report people for doing that and they'll get in trouble. That's how you prevent it. Limiting which champions they can choose prevents off meta picks and picking a high priority champion first to swap with someone further down in pick order on your team.

While the Solo player vs Team thing is unfortunately natural in that high ranked due to the significantly decreased pool of players in Challenger, those queue times are unacceptable. That is pretty stupid. I could watch a movie with that time.
so its safe to assume everyone in high elo is playing 5 man teams then and the 9 people left can't ever start a match O.O
Yeah its like that in PBE too lmao. literally impossible to use anything but blind pick.

I think I read that Riot would activate Solo/Duo Queue for those who doesnt want to go Dynamic in a future. I'm definitely waiting for this. I'm usually solo when ranking and I hate the new Dynamic poop. Full solo team vs 5 premade, I'm honestly thinking that Riot is lacking smart people on their team. (Specially the balancing team, see Xin buffs)

You're in Challenger, and you don't know that sometimes  a que will go stale? Every single format does that on occasion. You just get lost in translation (so to speak) between queing up and finding an actual game. The solution is pretty complicated. You have to leave que, and then que up again. In fact, this is something that frequently occurs in games that require waiting in a que for other players online to be put into a game with you. More so on computers than consoles because there are more factors. First world problems OP

Also, the higher up in the ranks you are, the longer que times you get. There are simply less people to pull match you up with. Changing the champ select for higher tiers won't change that. In fact, you'll be effectively changing ranked on someone once they've become used to it while climbing. Personally, I think that's a ridiculous idea. You should analyze factors before you rage man. Had you done that, you wouldn't have had to stay in que for 90 minutes, which I think that anyone who sits in que for 90 minutes without trying to reque or play a different format has some things to work out anyways. As in tradition of League community, you're going to want to argue about it. However, I won't indulge you in the hopes that you read this and let it sink in instead of giving you a distraction to vent through. Sorry you had to wait 90 minutes for a game. Silly or not, I know that was not fun for you, and I don't like anyone being truly unhappy.
In the old champion select (when the new one was down) I had 5-10 minute queue times, everytime.

In every game I have played in the last two days, I have not got my primary role (jungle) even once. I get stuck into bottom lane every time. Every game is either with a 4-man premade that refuses to communicate or against a pre-made, and we get curb stomped.

Dynamic Queue sucks ass. I am no longer playing it. Not in placements, not in normal draft. 100% Blind Pick until an actual solo queue is reinstated. I am also voting with my wallet by refusing to buy anything with cash until an actual solo queue is reinstated.

If position does not matter at the higher elo then wouldn't it speed things up if you all chose fill as your primary role?  Then once in champ select just told everyone what role you planned on playing and ignore the role given to you?
that and I dont like how you get a penaltie for not locking in like thats just dumb
honestly dynamic queue is a piece of shit idea, yet for some reason Riot thinks they've succeeded once again.

Hopefully, when they add true solo queue, it will cut down on queue times. However, I have no idea when it's coming. We already surpassed the initial intended roll out for it cause dynamic queue crashed and ate up developer resources.
Im just saying, if your gonna wait 90 minutes and not even try to restart the que, then your being a little obnoxious and looking for attention.
What?
He is just sitting in que rather than restarting the que.
